adjective.description: Based on or in accordance with reason or logic.
examples: I'm sure there's a perfectly rational explanation

adjective.description: (of a number, quantity, or expression) expressible, or containing quantities that are expressible, as a ratio of whole numbers. When expressed as a decimal, a rational number has a finite or recurring expansion.

origin: Late Middle English (in the sense having the ability to reason): from Latin rationalis, from ratio(n-) reckoning, reason (see ratio).
